author: wrowe
msg: Oh ... yea, there is a reason I never committed this months-old code
to CVS - reverting to 1.63.  Although the theory is right - we could
end up in a case of d:\ or \\unc\path\ where stripping off the trailing
slash of a root will introduce erratic behavior or fail entirely.
Needs to be conditional on not-a-root-path, and I don't have time to
hack that tonight.  Better to leave working code in CVS.  [sorry]

author: wrowe
msg: Another test to 'flunk'.  If the path is backslashed-terminated, we
don't know how applications might react.  Convention is no trailing
backslash on Win32 cwd paths - so strip it back off when it occurs.

author: jwoolley
msg: Add APR_RING_PREPEND() and APR_BRIGADE_PREPEND() as companions to _CONCAT()

author: stoddard
msg: Win32: Fix apr_proc_mutex_lock/trylock.  Getting WAIT_ABANDONED is
not a failure condition when calling WaitForSingleObject on a mutex.

author: aaron
msg: Mention the new APR_EXPAND_VAR m4 function.
